abstract: Home Depot‘s chief executive, Frank Blake, offered a reality check Wednesday to those who are hoping his company will soon become the biggest buyout target in history. “We’re not thinking about going private,” Mr. Blake said at a Metro Atlanta Chamber of Commerce conference. “We’re very pleased with the capital structure we have.” There has been speculation that Home Depot’s stalled stock price and its valuable real-estate assets could make the home-improvement retailer an attractive acquisition candidate for private equity firms. With a market capitalization of about $76 billion, though, Home Depot would be quite a tall order for even a posse of firms flush with cash.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot‘s chief executive, Frank Blake, offered a reality check Wednesday to those who are hoping his company will soon become the biggest buyout target in history. “We’re not thinking about going private,” Mr. Blake said at a Metro Atlanta Chamber of Commerce conference. “We’re very pleased with the capital structure we have.” There has been speculation that Home Depot’s stalled stock price and its valuable real-estate assets could make the home-improvement retailer an attractive acquisition candidate for private equity firms. With a market capitalization of about $76 billion, though, Home Depot would be quite a tall order for even a posse of firms flush with cash.

headline.main: Home Depot Chief: No Plans to Go Private
